name: TheAtlantic
text: Whatever Kanye West's emotional or mental status is from moment to moment, his campaign must, on some level, be thought of as real. @skornhaber dissects the rapper's presidential bid and quest for power https://t.co/MI9Mk9Xzwl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’m not sure I know what crazy looks like, but even today when I hear the word, I picture a split screen, the dreadlocked man in Kejetia on one side, my mother lying in bed on the other." Read an excerpt from Yaa Gyasi's forthcoming novel: https://t.co/NQ0udqNxnW

name: TheAtlantic
text: There’s new hope for fixing coronavirus testing in the U.S. After months of devastating shortfalls, a set of new tools and daring ideas could provide millions of tests a day and let us return to normal life, @yayitsrob and @alexismadrigal report: https://t.co/4SgFlEfipc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Contrary to President Trump’s claims, the USPS has both the money and the capacity to deal with a surge in mail-in ballots. But new policies could still get in the way of the election, @RussellBerman reports. https://t.co/DjTsDZj3pV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: With his actions toward the Postal Service, President Trump is once again conscripting the executive branch to serve his immediate interests, writes @RonBrownstein: https://t.co/BDso84IAJC

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PeterAtlantic: I was on phone w/ ex-ethics official Walt Shaub as Trump tweeted he might give convention speech at Gettysburg. Shaub: "Holy crap! Oh my God. Gettysburg is a national park! Basically, a political party is seizing control of a public park if that happens.”
https://t.co/xPYRgqyMF4

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic is hollowing out the presidential conventions. For all their flaws, they've produced moments that have upended the nation's politics, @PeterAtlantic writes: https://t.co/elTZuztR98

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At its core, amnesty is a recognition that there are more important things in this world than punishment," writes Michele Hall: https://t.co/05qGSnaWL5

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Great Depression permanently altered many people’s behavior. Could COVID-19 do the same? @jpinsk reports: https://t.co/u3uocdJ5Ck
